name: Green Bough Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: `Lovely bed and breakfast. We arrived late and the staff still managed to serve us a delicious meal and upgraded us to a junior suite. Nothing was too much trouble and we look forward to returning later in the year. A nice touch was the designer toiletries in the bathroom.
reviews.title: will return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and my husband are just back from a 2 night stay at the hotel and what a lovely stay it was too!!
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, fantastic hospitality!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the 'Tabley' room which was beautiful, clean, comfortable and cosy.
reviews.title: Good Experience all round

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are a credit to Janice and Philip who are the propietors, nothing was too much trouble and they were VERY friendly.
reviews.title: Lovely place to Stay

reviews.text: We dined in the restaurant on the first evening and can vouch that the food is absolutely exquisite and the wine menu is superb. Thanks to the lovely weather we were blessed with, we managed to take advantage of the roof-top terrace which is lovely on a warm evening.
reviews.title: Agree with other positive assessments; access could be an issue

reviews.text: This was a second or third time here for work, and again the service and attention to detail was excellent. My room was spacious and comfortable (Eaton) and all the staff did everything to make us feel at home and to allow us to work comfortably. Breakfast was very good too, as always, and the food in the restaurant every lunchtime was delicious.
reviews.title: Excellent again

reviews.text: Highly recommended, again.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good Hotel + location, cosy atmosphere, excellent service, attentive, kind, ready to assist - Thank you Janice, & thanks David for giving us a rid downtown!
reviews.title: Lovely stay in Chester

reviews.text: Rooms are simply furnished and comfortable, bathroom are a bit small.
reviews.title: Superb personal service!
Would not recommend!
reviews.text: Excellent food, Michelin star level.

My husband and I stayed here for one night. I must say I was disappointed with this hotel. After reading so many other reviews where people had free upgrades and nice gestures in their room for special occasions I was a bit upset to find none of this applied to us. This was the case even though the hotel was empty, we booked months in advance and were even asked at the time of booking if this was a special occasion. There was not even a "happy anniversary" said to us.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: We were in the Rode Junior Suite and this did not meet our expectations. There are cracks in the wall, stains on the carpet and a bedknob missing. The shower was also inadequate.
reviews.title: What a marvellous welcome.

reviews.text: Despite the above we would like to give credit to the lovely lady who served us at dinner and breakfast and advised us on where to park for the city centre.
reviews.title: Reunion of Traveller Friends

reviews.text: An average stay for an expensive price.
reviews.title: Home from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were only staying in Chester one night. Had we known this hotel was going to be so good we would haves extended the visit. The staff were so accommodating and the hotel so well cared for we will be back.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem

reviews.text: We had a last minute deal through a website were we had a deal on a deluxe double room & breakfast for 2 nights. We were met with a wonderful, warm welcome & our room was something special! Very luxurious with beautiful, tasteful decor & spotlessly clean. I felt spoilt with thick cotton robes & toiletries from The White Company. All staff were so very friendly & made us feel very welcome. We ate at the restaurant, Olive Tree, situated at the hotel on the Saturday evening with a three course meal which is absolutely beautiful! I would highly recommend Green Bough to anyone who would like a weekend away to relax, unwind & be though of as a vip. Beautiful!
reviews.title: AMAZING!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Chester. The room we had was luxurious, on the ground floor so it was ideal if you are disabled with only a few small steps into the front door. It was the Cholmondley.
reviews.title: We cannot fault this hotel in any way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were excellent, attentive and caring. The food also was excellent.
reviews.title: Very Welcoming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would certainly go back there.
reviews.title: 70th Birthday Celebration break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mr and Mrs Cooper
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, brilliant staff!!

description: Winner of 'best Small Hotel Of The Year 2006', Enjoy England for Excellence Awards. A warm, friendly welcome; luxurious surroundings, relaxing ambiance; thoughtful, professional service; superb food; dedication. The award-winning Green Bough is an exclusive, privately owned, Victorian Townhouse, lovingly restored using Italian wall-coverings and fabrics and original antique beds to provide sumptuous, individually designed, bedrooms and suites.
